instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message:
I have this 17" 820-2914-A that has no backlight. 
what i've done so far

backlight fuse test good with 12.3v on both sides
checked for voltage a lvds connector pins 38,39,40 i get 38.2v
checked pin 4 i get 3.2v 
checked pin 2-3 i get 3.1v
i have replaced both lcd and cable with known tested components

it is posting video just no backlight. not really sure what I'm missing. any ideas?
​​​​​​​​​​​​​​

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: 38V means there is no load on the bus. Check connector/cable/LCD. You can connect a 15" assembly for testing if available.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: thanks duke. i did test with anther 17" and 15" using tested cables  with same result. the only think i have left to try is change the connector. i will try and report back.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: Just measure continuity to the end of a separate LCD cable

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: yes i have continuity to the end of a lcd cable .001. multimeter beeps when i have continuity.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: Voltage on BKLT_EN and BKLT_PWM, LCD must be connected.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message:
voltage on BKLT_EN ON R9715 is 3.11v
voltage on BKLT_EN ON R9731 IS 0.0V
voltage on BKLT_PWM ON R9704 IS 0.0V

i find it interesting that there is voltage on r9715 but not on r9731 so i checked for continuity and everything seems ok.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message:
If it is on R9715 it must be on R9731, it is a resistor divider and one cannot work without the other. It does mean that I cannot rely on your measurements though cause they are obviously wrong.
But BKLT_PWM is not there if you measured correctly. Do a PRAM reset and see if it comes on. May need to do it a few times and power off and boot into OSX. Then try to turn up the brightness on the keyboard.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: i've measured them a couple times because thats what i thought too. and still same results. but in the mean time i decided to check for short to ground on bklt_pwm and sure enough it was grounded. i traced it back to R9693 removed the resistor and sure enough short to ground on pin1 of R9693. I'm guessing this means U9600 has an issue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: Measure on R9704 if there is a short to GND. If yes then remove it and see on which side it is.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: i did remove the r9704 and the short to ground is on the pin 2 LVDS_BLK_PWM_RC. Which if I'm correct means i have to change U9701. ill report back soon as i get that changed.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: ok. i got the U9701 changed with no more short to ground on LVDS_BLK_PWM_RC,  but still no voltage on it and no voltage on either side of R9704 which i believe comes from R9693 which has no voltage either. so would that be an smc issue?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: Remove R9704 and connect pin 2 to C9711. This puts 3V on the PWM input and LCD will always be on full brightness. Else you need to change the MUX which is not worth the hassle.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: i did as asked with running a wire and it worked. So what I'm wondering is could i run a wire from a 3.3v sleep line and have the screen turn off during sleep mode?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: Uhm backlight should go off in sleep, does it stay on? Does it even really go to sleep, light on front pulsing? I bet J4800 not connected.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message:
i just miss read what u said, thought the backlight would always be on when the machine is on or in sleep. but i see now its just the screen brightness will always be at highest.
right now I'm just testing for backlight out of the system, i will put the board back in the case and test then report back.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2914-A no backlight issue
threads.message: It does go to sleep but screen brightness is not adjustable which I'm ok with. Hopefully it doesn't kill the battery too fast lol.
